definitions: large hairy humanoid creature believed to inhabit forests of North America
examples: Hikers reported seeing a sasquatch near the mountain trail
The documentary explored evidence of sasquatch sightings in Oregon

definitions: standardized test widely used for college admissions in the United States
examples: She studied all summer to improve her SAT scores
The SAT includes sections on math and verbal reasoning

definitions: supreme evil spirit and adversary of God in Abrahamic religions
examples: Medieval art often depicted Satan with horns and a tail
The preacher warned against the temptations of Satan

definitions: religious or philosophical belief system centered on Satan or opposition to traditional religious values
examples: The documentary examined various forms of modern Satanism
Media reports often misrepresent the actual beliefs of Satanism

definitions: sixth planet from the sun known for its prominent ring system
ancient Roman god of agriculture and time
examples: Saturn's rings are visible through a small telescope
The Cassini spacecraft spent years studying Saturn
Ancient Romans celebrated Saturn during winter festivals
The temple of Saturn stood in the Roman Forum

definitions: native or citizen of Saudi Arabia or relating to its culture
examples: The Saudi delegation arrived for the trade conference
Many Saudis work in the petroleum industry

definitions: tropical grassland with scattered trees and seasonal rainfall patterns
personal name commonly used for females
examples: Lions hunt zebras across the African savannah
The savannah supports diverse wildlife during the rainy season
Savannah invited her friends to the birthday party
My niece Savannah just started kindergarten this year

definitions: person who saves someone from danger or difficult situation
examples: The firefighter was hailed as the child's savior
Christians believe Jesus Christ is their savior

definitions: person who saves someone from danger or difficult situation
examples: The doctor was seen as their saviour during the epidemic
She became the company's saviour by securing new funding

definitions: shortened form of saxophone, a brass wind instrument with reed mouthpiece
examples: He played smooth jazz on his tenor sax
The sax solo brought the audience to their feet

definitions: member of ancient Germanic people who invaded and settled in Britain
examples: The Saxons established several kingdoms in medieval England
Anglo-Saxon culture influenced the English language significantly

definitions: region in northern Europe comprising Norway, Sweden, and Denmark
examples: They traveled through Scandinavia to see the midnight sun
Scandinavia is known for its high quality of life

definitions: native or inhabitant of Scandinavia or relating to its culture
examples: The Scandinavian design aesthetic emphasizes simplicity and functionality
Many Scandinavians speak excellent English as a second language

definitions: major American publisher of educational materials and children's books
examples: Scholastic publishes the Harry Potter series in America
The school ordered new reading materials from Scholastic

definitions: religious movement founded by L. Ron Hubbard based on self-help principles
examples: The Church of Scientology has centers in major cities
Critics debate whether Scientology qualifies as a religion

definitions: eighth astrological sign representing people born between October 23 and November 21
constellation in southern sky resembling a scorpion
examples: As a Scorpio, she was known for her passionate nature
People born under Scorpio are said to be intense
The constellation Scorpio is visible in summer evenings
Ancient astronomers saw a scorpion shape in Scorpio

definitions: predatory arachnid with eight legs and segmented tail ending in venomous stinger
examples: The desert scorpion glowed under ultraviolet light
A scorpion sting can be dangerous without proper treatment

definitions: native or inhabitant of Scotland
examples: The proud Scot wore his family tartan to the wedding
Many Scots emigrated to Canada in the nineteenth century

definitions: whisky distilled in Scotland from malted barley
transparent adhesive tape used for general purposes
examples: He ordered a single malt Scotch on the rocks
The bar featured an extensive collection of aged Scotch
She used Scotch tape to wrap the birthday present
The poster was held up with pieces of Scotch

definitions: country forming northern part of Great Britain
examples: Scotland is famous for its castles and Highland scenery
The capital of Scotland is Edinburgh

definitions: man who is a native or inhabitant of Scotland
examples: The Scotsman explained the history of his clan
A young Scotsman invented the television

definitions: Scottish terrier, a small dog breed with wiry coat and distinctive beard
examples: The black Scottie barked at passing strangers
President Roosevelt's Scottie named Fala became famous

definitions: of or relating to Scotland, its people, or their culture
examples: The Scottish Highlands attract millions of tourists annually
She loved listening to traditional Scottish bagpipe music

definitions: board game where players score points by forming words from letter tiles
examples: The family played Scrabble every Sunday evening
She won the Scrabble tournament with a seven-letter word

definitions: person who copies documents by hand or serves as professional writer
examples: Medieval scribes preserved ancient texts in monasteries
The scribe carefully recorded the court proceedings

definitions: artist who creates three-dimensional artworks by carving or shaping materials
examples: The sculptor chiseled the marble into a beautiful statue
Famous sculptors often work with bronze, stone, or clay

definitions: person who works aboard a ship as member of the crew
examples: The experienced seaman navigated through the stormy waters
Young seamen trained for months before their first voyage

definitions: confused mixture of sounds or voices
biblical tower whose builders were confused by different languages
examples: The crowded market was a babel of different languages
The meeting descended into a babel of arguing voices
The Tower of Babel story explains the origin of languages
Artists often depict Babel as an unfinished spiral tower

definitions: ancient Mesopotamian city that was capital of the Babylonian Empire
examples: The Hanging Gardens of Babylon were one of the Seven Wonders
Archaeologists continue excavating the ruins of ancient Babylon

definitions: inhabitant of ancient Babylon or relating to its civilization
examples: Babylonian astronomers made detailed observations of the stars
The museum displayed Babylonian cuneiform tablets

definitions: salt-cured pork typically from the belly or back cuts
examples: The smell of frying bacon filled the kitchen
She ordered eggs and crispy bacon for breakfast

definitions: stocky mammal with black and white striped face that lives in underground burrows
examples: The badger emerged from its sett at twilight
European badgers live in complex underground tunnel systems

definitions: large bundle of material compressed and bound for storage or transport
examples: The farmer loaded bales of hay onto the truck
Cotton bales were stacked high in the warehouse

definitions: relating to the Balkan Peninsula in southeastern Europe
examples: Balkan cuisine features influences from many different cultures
The Balkan mountains stretch across several countries

definitions: relating to the Baltic Sea or countries surrounding it
examples: Baltic amber contains prehistoric insects trapped inside
The Baltic states regained independence in 1991

definitions: major branch of African languages spoken across central and southern Africa
examples: Swahili is one of the most widely spoken Bantu languages
Bantu languages share similar grammatical structures

definitions: member of Protestant Christian denomination emphasizing baptism by full immersion
examples: The Baptist church held baptisms in the river
Many Baptists gather for weekly prayer meetings

definitions: person whose occupation is cutting and styling hair, especially men's hair
examples: The barber gave him a classic short haircut
He visited the same barber shop every three weeks

definitions: highly ornate artistic and architectural style from 17th and 18th century Europe
examples: The baroque church featured elaborate gold decorations
Baroque music is characterized by complex harmonies

definitions: aromatic herb with green leaves used in cooking, especially Italian cuisine
examples: Fresh basil leaves enhanced the tomato sauce perfectly
She grew several varieties of basil in her garden

definitions: member of people living in the Pyrenees region of Spain and France
examples: The Basque language is unrelated to any other known language
Traditional Basque festivals feature unique sports and dances

definitions: medieval fortress in Paris whose storming in 1789 began the French Revolution
examples: The storming of the Bastille is celebrated on July 14th
Political prisoners were held in the Bastille before the revolution

definitions: large semiaquatic rodent with flat tail that builds dams across streams
examples: The beaver gnawed through tree trunks with powerful teeth
Beavers created a pond by damming the creek
